item.title: "Even Gods Can’t Predict the Future" - Flintlock Dev on Petting Enki
item.description:
One of the most often-asked questions about animal companions in video games is if players can pet them. Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn illustrates that this remains true, even when that animal companion is a deity like the adorable foxlike Enki.

When talking with Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn ’s lead narrative designer Daniel Baider, Game Rant, of course, had to ask if players could pet the cute divine companion that joins Nor Vanek on her journey. Teasingly, Baider’s answer was more than a simple yes or no.

Can You Pet the God?

Enki has become a fairly popular character even before the game’s release. He’s taken Twitter by storm, and he’s been jokingly called the game’s actual protagonist by his growing legions of fans. No small part of this is the character’s rich personality packed into a cute fox companion for Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn protagonist Nor Vanek. And Enki is very important to Nor’s journey. He enables her magic and traversal mechanics, as well as being her guide to the various gods she will encounter on her journey. While he's cute and offers all of this, Enki at his core is very much a divine being. As Baider explained, that means that he has a very strong opinion on whether or not he should get pets.

“There’s no dedicated button for patting Enki, as he is after all a God and would never willingly subject himself to such indignity.”

Ultimately, it does seem like a fair position for a god. While getting pets is a form of praise, gods in general tend to prefer their praise to be more of the reverent worship kind, after all. Enki has a strong sympathy for humankind, so he may not be demanding worship (which may be willingly given by some). Still, he is a god and a dedicated pet button could feel diminishing to him. However, Baider left the door open for another option.

He did say Enki wouldn’t willingly subject himself to such indignity–not that he doesn’t suffer such indignity. Baider doesn't say that it never happens in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn 's story, meaning somewhere among its runtime, fans may still see some pets. Baider didn’t rule out this possibility, but he didn’t confirm it either:

“As for whether it ever happens in the game, even Gods can’t predict the future....”

Despite their reputation, Soulslike/Souls-lite games can be rather funny from time to time, and it certainly would be funny to see the furry god have to endure fawning pets from Nor or others on occasion in the story. After all, the relationship between Enki and Nor is the beating heart of the game, so enriching it with humor would do a lot to endear that companionship to players if executed well. In fact, from that perspective, a dedicated pet button would somewhat cheapen the significance of such a moment.

item.title: Once Human: How To Disable Text Chat
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Disable Text Chat In Once Human

Once Human is an open-world survival game that grants players the freedom to build their own territory, explore the open world, and take on terrifying bosses to progress through the game's story. This free-to-play game gives players quite a lot to dive into, and although players will never be alone when joining a public server for their first playthrough, they can also match up with friends and survive together.

Once Human is a multiplayer experience, meaning players are bound to bump into each other during their exploration. While some may opt to team up with those they encounter, they also have the freedom to go solo. For players looking to communicate, Once Human offers an in-game text chat along with proximity chat, but also offers the ability to disable all in-game chatter entirely. Here is how to disable the text chat feature in Once Human !

How To Disable Text Chat In Once Human

Disabling the text chat feature in Once Human is relatively simple. To start, players will need to press the F1 key to bring up the Contacts menu , and then navigate over to Settings . Once in the Settings menu, they can then head over to the Messages tab . From here, players will be presented with the channel settings, each of which can be toggled to control what messages show up in the Once Human text chat. These settings are as follows:

  • System Channel
  • Regional Channel
  • World Channel
  • Team Channels
  • Hive Channel
  • Warband Channel

For players who want to disable all in-game chatter altogether, setting each channel to Off is the best option . However, if players still want to receive messages from individuals who are part of their team, Hive, or Warband, they can keep those channels open and disable only the System, Regional, and World channels.

item.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 Studio’s Award Streak Is Affecting Development
item.description:
Highlights

  • Larian Studios enacted a strategy of rotating teams to attend each of the many award ceremonies following the massive success of Baldur's Gate 3.
  • The game's overwhelming popularity was a challenge for the studio, as attending award shows impacted development.
  • Larian is currently working on its next game, said to be an entirely new IP.

Baldur's Gate 3 developer Larian Studios has shared that the game's streak of consecutive industry wins started to affect development, pushing the studio to opt for a certain strategy when attending award ceremonies. Over the past year, Baldur's Gate 3 has amassed an impressive tally of accolades, with its latest win coming just last week at the 2024 Develop Star Awards.

Larian Studios released Baldur's Gate 3 in August 2023 and was instantly met with waves of positive reviews, mirroring the game's highly successful early access period in 2020. The Dungeons & Dragons -inspired RPG received a perfect score from multiple critics, selling millions of Baldur's Gate 3 copies in the process. In the following months, the game was showered with countless accolades, including multiple Game of the Year awards. While this attention helped the studio's popularity, it also introduced some tough challenges.

In an interview with Edge (via GamesRadar), Larian Studios CEO and Baldur's Gate 3 director Swen Vincke expressed his appreciation for the studio being bestowed with various awards, but explained that the sheer number of award ceremonies to be attended "affects development." Upon sensing that the scintillating success of the fantasy RPG would mean getting awards at several different events, he said that the studio devised a strategy of "rotating teams" according to which "different people went to different award shows."

The Toll Of Baldur's Gate 3's Award Winning Spree

Discussing how Larian devs often had to quickly prepare to receive another award at a different ceremony as soon as they had finished at another, Vincke said that the magnitude of Baldur's Gate 3 's success came close to being "too much." The game director further revealed that he would prefer a one-and-done event instead, explaining that it "would be cool if everybody could agree to do it all at the same time" as he views the current format as something that is "surprisingly draining on the soul." Moreover, Vincke stated how the continued popularity of Baldur's Gate 3 has made Larian devs "more emotional" as they are unable to find closure, which he states is a desirable thing at the end of such a major project.

Game development is a long and complex endeavor, which sometimes sees devs bending over backwards to meet tight deadlines and engaging in 'crunch' as release windows approach. It's understandable how frequent award ceremony appearances could start becoming an impediment to a studio's day-to-day business. However, the Baldur's Gate 3 team's balancing act seems to be working, as the studio's workers continues to travel to award shows while teasing fans about the state of forthcoming Larian Studios games.

item.title: Elden Ring: All Legendary Armaments In Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Ancient Meteoric Ore Greatsword
  • Sword Of Darkness
  • Sword Of Light
  • Euporia

In Elden Ring , legendary weapons belong to a special class of armaments that often feature unique designs and skills . Sometimes, these weapons also include unique lore that helps players piece together the game's mysterious plot. While the base game includes nine unique legendary weapons, the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC introduces four more.

These new legendary weapons are hidden in secret areas, and two of them require solving a challenging puzzle. If you wish to acquire all four legendary weapons in the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion, the following guide will prove invaluable.

Ancient Meteoric Ore Greatsword

Shaped Like An Arrow, Deals AOE Magic Damage

Attribute Requirement

Str-35; Dex-10; Arc-19

Weapon Scaling

Str-D; Dex-E; Arc-D

Weapon Type

Colossal Sword

Unique Skill

White Light Charge

The Ancient Meteoric Ore Greatsword can be obtained from the furnace in the Ancient Ruins of Starfall Past. The ruins are located southwest of the Moorth Ruins Site of Grace . The legendary greatsword scales well with Strength and Dexterity.

Besides the incredible raw damage output, the weapon's unique skill, White Light Charge, also deals magic damage without requiring Intelligence or Faith. Since the weapon can be found relatively early in the game, you can rely on it for the majority of the DLC after upgrading it to +10.

Sword Of Darkness

Raise The Sword To Surround Yourself With Darkness & Deal Holy Damage

Attribute Requirement

Str-14; Dex-11; Fai-24

Weapon Scaling

Str-D; Dex-E; Fai-E

Weapon Type

Straight Sword

Unique Skill

Darkness

The Sword of Darkness is a legendary straight sword that you can acquire after finding the Stone Sheathed Sword in one of the three unique altars in the Shadow Realm. You can find these three altars in the following locations:

  • Fog Rift Catacombs : In a secret chamber, accessible after stepping onto the three falling spiked traps.
  • Ruins of Unte : Behind the temple blocked by an inactive Furnace Golem.
  • Ancient Ruins of Rauh : On a tower, connected by an invisible walkway.

Once you have the Stone Sheathed Sword in your inventory, you can visit the second altar to transform the weapon into the Sword of Darkness . Activating the weapon's unique skill causes the Tarnished to raise the weapon in the air, releasing a gust of darkness that swivels around, dealing holy damage to all enemies caught in it, while negating holy damage to self .

Sword Of Light

Raise The Sword In Air To Emit Rays Of Blinding Light & Deal Holy Damage

Attribute Requirement

Str-14; Dex-11; Fai-24

Weapon Scaling

Str-D; Dex-E; Fai-E

Weapon Type

Straight Sword

Unique Skill

Light

The Sword of Light is also a legendary straight sword that can be acquired in the same way you obtain the Sword of Darkness. Once you've transformed the Stone Sheathed Sword into the Sword of Darkness, you must visit the final remaining altar in the Realm of Shadows , and interact with it to transform the Sword of Darkness into the Sword of Light.

The weapon comes equipped with a unique skill called Light. When executing the skill, the Tarnished raises the weapon in the air, following which, rays of blinding light emanate from the weapon . Using the weapon skill also temporarily boosts the Tarnished's holy attacks.

You can only obtain the Sword of Darkness or Sword of Light in one playthrough of Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. To obtain both versions of the weapon, you'll need to replay the DLC at least a second time.

Euporia

Legendary Twinblade That Charge-Up After Successive Attacks

Attribute Requirement

Str-16; Dex-16; Fai-24

Weapon Scaling

Str-D; Dex-D; Fai-D

Weapon Type

Twinblade

Unique Skill

Euporia Vortex

The legendary Euporia Twinblade's lore states that it is a secret treasure of the Enir-Ilim. The blades are located in a difficult-to-reach area, accessible only after you complete a major event towards the end of the game.

The Euporia Twinblade deals holy damage, and when it strikes enemies, the blades emit a radiant glow, boosting its holy damage output. Its unique skill, Euporia Vortex, enables the Tarnished to spin the blades in front of them, creating a whirling barrier that damages any enemy attempting to attack .

You cannot charge Euporia's blades when striking Those Who Live in Dead.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Director Shows Interest in 24-Player Savage Raids
item.description:
Highlights

  • Final Fantasy 14 director Naoki Yoshida is interested in introducing a challenging 24-player Savage raid in the Shades' Triangle exploration zone.
  • Square Enix considered feedback from the previous exploration zones, Bozja and Eureka, for the new foray.
  • The new exploration zone will be released in stages, starting with the Patch 7.2 series.

At a convention panel, Final Fantasy 14 producer and director Naoki Yoshida stated his interest in bringing 24-player Savage raids to Dawntrail as part of new exploration zone content. While no further information was given, the Final Fantasy 14 lead stated that the planning portion of the new adventuring foray had wrapped up, and the programming phase was underway.

Final Fantasy 14: Dawntrail , the fifth expansion for Square Enix's critically acclaimed MMORPG, brought the game's first major graphical update and a slew of new content for players to participate in. Between leveling the new Viper and Pictomancer combat Jobs, and taking on two new Extreme Trials at level 100, Dawntrail has been praised by players for its challenging combat and encounter design. Players looking for more fights to take on will not have long to wait, as Patch 7.01 will see the first four rounds of the Arcadion 8-player raid series released on Normal difficulty, alongside Job balance updates. On July 30, Patch 7.05 will allow players to challenge the first Arcadion Savage raid tier.

With the upcoming Savage raid tier right around the corner, Yoshida took time to give raid-focused players a glimpse into future content. During an interview with the French-language website Millenium.org, Yoshida teased that a 24-player Savage raid in the game's upcoming exploration zone was among the things he expressed interest in bringing to the table. While further details about the Shades' Triangle exploration zone remained light, Yoshida confirmed that the Final Fantasy 14 development team looked at things from the previous adventuring forays, Bozja and Eureka, and took the best of both to implement in Shades' Triangle. Yoshida said that the new exploration zone would be available in increments, starting in the Patch 7.2 update series.

Final Fantasy 14's New Exploration Zone May Include A 24-Player Savage Raid

  • Naoki Yoshida expressed interest in giving players a challenging raid in the Shades' Triangle exploration zone.
  • Square Enix took feedback from Bozja and Eureka into consideration with the new foray.
  • Shades' Triangle will be released in multiple segments, starting in the Patch 7.2 update series.
  • No further information about the exploratory content was given.

During the Bozja adventuring forays, a raid called Delubrum Reginae was released in Patch 5.45, with both Normal and Savage difficulty options. The Savage version allows for 24 to 48 players to join in, and a Cerberus mount is the reward for players who complete it. During the same interview session with French media, Yoshida discussed the ways he wants to keep Final Fantasy 14 character progression interesting in future expansions. With Dawntrail 's launch, the level cap was raised to 100.

Yoshida said that the Final Fantasy 14 development team is looking into seeing if additional Job complexity or an entirely new skill system can be added in future releases. Between requests for additional player and NPC interactions and the confirmed combat-focused updates, only time will tell what Square Enix will do to keep players engaged.
